terms.TCP/IP stack: A layered software implementation of the TCP/IP protocol suite
terms.TAP device: Virtual network kernel interface providing Ethernet frame-level access to userspace
terms.ARP cache poisoning: Attack where malicious ARP replies corrupt the IP→MAC mapping table
terms.Broadcast MAC: Ethernet address for all local devices
terms.ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol): A supporting protocol used for network diagnostics and error reporting
terms.TTL (Time To Live): A field in the IP header that limits the lifetime of a packet to prevent infinite routing loops
terms.TCP Control Block (TCB): Data structure containing all state for a single TCP connection
terms.Three-way handshake: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK exchange for connection establishment
terms.Four-way handshake: FIN-ACK exchange in both directions for graceful connection termination
terms.Acknowledgment Number: Next expected sequence number in TCP
terms.Retransmission Timeout (RTO): Dynamic timer for resending lost segments
terms.Congestion Control: TCP mechanism to avoid network overload
terms.Congestion Window (cwnd): Sender-side limit based on network capacity
terms.Congestion Avoidance: Additive increase phase of congestion control
terms.Postel's Law: Principle: 'Be conservative in what you send, liberal in what you accept'
terms.mock TAP device: In-memory replacement for real TAP device for testing
terms.test harness: Framework for running and validating tests
terms.packet capture and replay: Testing technique using recorded network traffic
terms.network namespaces: Linux feature for isolated network environments
terms.valgrind: Tool for memory debugging and leak detection
terms.function pointer injection: Technique for replacing functions at runtime for testing
terms.layered debugging principle: Debug lower layers before upper layers when network issues occur
terms.scientific method applied to network pro: Observe, hypothesize, experiment, fix debugging approach
terms.network microscope: Metaphor for packet capture tools like Wireshark
terms.Minimal Working Example: Reduced test case isolating the core bug
terms.UDP (User Datagram Protocol): Connectionless, unreliable transport protocol for simple datagram service
terms.TLS/SSL (Transport Layer Security/Secure: Cryptographic protocols for secure communication over TCP
terms.HTTP/1.1 (Hypertext Transfer Protocol): Application-layer protocol for distributed, collaborative hypermedia systems
terms.NAT (Network Address Translation): Method of remapping IP address space by modifying network address information in IP headers
terms.RIP (Routing Information Protocol): Distance-vector routing protocol using hop count as routing metric
terms.SACK (Selective Acknowledgment): TCP option that allows receiver to acknowledge non-contiguous blocks of data
terms.ACK: Acknowledgment flag and number in TCP
terms.Advertised Window: Receiver's buffer space available for receiving data
terms.ARP: Address Resolution Protocol for IP-to-MAC mapping
